alert.note: Alert for Cannon; De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Rutherford; Smith; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 11:26PM CDT until March 25 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Smith County in Middle Tennessee... De Kalb County in Middle Tennessee... Northeastern Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee... Jackson County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... West central Putnam County in Middle Tennessee... Northern Cannon County in Middle Tennessee... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1125 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hartsville to near Watertown to 7 miles southeast of Walterhill, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Smithville, Carthage, Gainesboro, Gordonsville, Hickman, South Carthage, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown, Whitleyville, Dixon Springs, Pleasant Shade, Center Hill Lake, Granville, Edgar Evans State Park and Milton. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 251 and 275. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Cannon; De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Rutherford; Smith; Wilson
